title: Crystal Palace 'take action' to track down those who racially abused Wilfried Zaha on social media
text:
Crystal Palace will actively attempt to track down the perpetrators who have racially abused Wilfried Zaha on social media.

Palace will also urge other clubs to take action if any of their fans are found to have targeted Zaha, who has suffered abuse over a series of months.

In the first instance Palace have reported the incidents to the social media platforms such as Twitter, which is under growing pressure to act, but the Premier League club is itself also prepared to go much further to investigate the abuse.

It will look into the identity of abusers, many of whom hide behind false names, and if any are Palace fans they will face sanctions such as losing their season tickets, being banned or the involvement of the police with a view to a criminal prosecution.

Similarly if it is found that a fan of another club has attacked Zaha Palace will urge the club to also take appropriate action.

In a statement Palace said: "Crystal Palace Football Club has taken action after one of our players, Wilfried Zaha, has again been subjected to racist abuse on social media.

"We will not tolerate this behaviour being directed at any of our players and will fully support them in dealing with such incidents.
description: Crystal Palace will actively attempt to track down the perpetrators who have racially abused Wilfried Zaha on social media.
